frame.name: Long_or_short_selling
frame.definition: <def-root>A common finance market concept that involves a <fen>Lender</fen> who lends some form of <fen>Assets</fen> to an <fen>Intermediary</fen> who in turn will sell those <fen>Assets</fen> to the <fen>Market</fen>. The eventual intent is for the <fen>Intermediary</fen> to repurchase the <fen>Assets</fen> from the <fen>Market</fen> for profit and return them to the <fen>Lender</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Lender
FE.definition: <def-root>The original owner and soon to be <fen>Lender</fen> of the <fen>Assets</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Intermediary
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity that is the borrower to the <fen>Lender</fen> and the seller and later repurchaser to the <fen>Market</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Market
FE.definition: <def-root>The aggregate selling place of many types of financial stocks, bond, securities, etc. The <fen>Market</fen> is also a metonym for the people who buy the <fen>Assets</fen>. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: sell long.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: the intermediary profits from selling stocks high and buy them back lower then he/she bought them.

lexUnit.name: sell short.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: the intermediary profits from selling stocks high and buy them back lower then he/she bought them.
